p: A total of 382 participants’ data was included in the analysis. 53% were female, 23% were in the age range of 15–24 years, while 27%, 20% and 29% were in the age range 25–34 years, 35–44 years and 45 years or above, respectively. Majority (88%) resided in Kigali. Majority (91%) achieved viral load suppression (VLS) (defined as a viral load result of less than 1000 copies/mL) based on last recorded viral load result. Less than half (48%) had attended scheduled ART collection clinic appointments during the lockdown period of 21 March to 30 April 2020.
